current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Under Secretary for Oceans and Atmosphere to conduct an assessment of cultural and
			 historic resources in the waters of the Great Lakes, and for other
			 purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Assessment of cultural and historic resources in waters of Great Lakes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Under Secretary for Oceans
			 and Atmosphere

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
conduct an assessment of cultural and historic resources in the waters of the Great Lakes; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on
			 the findings of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on
			 Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a/p:2

text.#text:
Identification of underwater geographic areas in the Great Lakes that possess historical and
			 archaeological resources of sufficient value and density to make them
			 nationally significant.
A description of the historical and archaeological resources in such geographic areas.
An evaluation of community interest in preserving and interpreting such resources.

A recommendation regarding whether such geographic areas should be designated as national marine
			 sanctuaries to protect resources of historical and archeological
			 significance.

Recommendations regarding whether the designation of a network of underwater Great Lakes areas that
			 protect resources of historical and archeological significance, including
			 the existing successful
			 Thunder Bay National Marine Sanctuary, could bring significant educational
			 opportunities, economic development,
			 jobs, and tourism to the Great Lakes region.
In carrying out this section, the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2556 IS: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
